node.statement: (Uniform integrability of R_eps) The family {R_eps}_{eps > 0} is uniformly integrable w.r.t. the measures {mu_eps}. This follows from: (a) For each eps, R_eps = exp(Psi_eps) with E_{mu_eps}[R_eps] = 1. (b) The exponent Psi_eps = Psi_eps^{ren} + L_eps + K_eps has the property that Psi_eps^{ren} converges in L^p(mu) for p >= 1 (by exponential integrability of Wick powers). (c) The divergent parts L_eps + K_eps together form a normalized exponential tilt: exp(L_eps + K_eps) has E_{mu_eps}[exp(Psi_eps^{ren}) exp(L_eps + K_eps)] = 1, so {R_eps} is an L^1-bounded martingale-like family. (d) By de la Vallee-Poussin criterion, uniform integrability follows from the L^p bound E_{mu_eps}[R_eps^p] <= C_p for some p > 1, which holds by Holder inequality using the exponential integrability of Psi_eps^{ren}.
